briefTitle: Negative Pressure Wound Therapy in Healing Abdominal Incision in Obese Patients Undergoing Breast Reconstruction Surgery
officialTitle: A Randomized, Prospective Evaluation of Negative Pressure Wound Therapy on Abdominal Donor Site in Free Flap Breast Reconstruction in Obese Patients
conditions: Body Mass Index Greater Than or Equal to 30, Malignant Breast Neoplasm, Mammoplasty Patient, Obesity
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients undergoing a free abdominal flap, including a superficial inferior epigastric artery (SIEA), deep inferior epigastric artery perforator (DIEP), or muscle-sparing transverse rectus abdominus myocutaneous (MS-TRAM) flap for breast reconstruction.
* Patients are willing and able to give consent.
* Body mass index (BMI) greater than or equal to 30.0.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients who are unable to provide consent.
* Patients who are suspected or known to be pregnant.
* Known allergy to topical adhesives.
